questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a preventive control for physical access?

discussion.content: Answer is A all the others are detective controls

Selected Answer: A
Implementing a fingerprint-based access control system for the building is an example of a preventive control for physical access. This type of control prevents unauthorized individuals from gaining physical access to the building by requiring a biometric verification (fingerprint) before allowing entry.

questions.question_text: Which of the following should be considered when examining fire suppression systems as part of a data center environmental controls review?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
When examining fire suppression systems as part of a data center environmental controls review, the most relevant consideration is maintenance procedures. Regular and proper maintenance of fire suppression systems is crucial to ensuring their effectiveness in the event of a fire. This includes routine inspections, testing, and adherence to maintenance schedules.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would be MOST effective to protect information assets in a data center from theft by a vendor?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Keeping an eye on vendors and limiting their activities is the most effective way to prevent theft as it enables oversight.

This includes implementing controls such as access controls, surveillance systems, and logging mechanisms.

In the context of a new system development project running late against a critical implementation deadline, the most important activity is to perform user acceptance testing (UAT). User acceptance testing is a critical phase in the development process where end-users validate whether the system meets their requirements and expectations. Identifying and addressing any issues during UAT is crucial before the system is implemented, as it helps ensure that the system functions as intended and meets the needs of the users.
